util.spring.http

Class MediaTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.spring.http.MediaTypes

  • public class MediaTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper methods to deal with media types.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      MediaTypes() 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean acceptsMediaType(org.springframework.http.MediaType toMatch, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Does the given request has an Accept header containing any media type compatible to the one to match?

      Attempts to parse the given comma-separated list of media types and find which of them are compatible with the specified one to match.

    • Method Detail

      • tryParseMediaTypes

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<org.springframework.http.MediaType> tryParseMediaTypes(java.lang.String csv)
        Attempts to parse the given comma-separated list of media types.
        Parameters:
        csv - the string to parse.
        Returns:
        the parsed media types; if a parse error occurs, the returned stream will be empty.

      • findCompatibleMediaTypes

        public static java.util.stream.Stream<org.springframework.http.MediaType> findCompatibleMediaTypes(org.springframework.http.MediaType toMatch,
                                                                                                   java.lang.String csv)
        Attempts to parse the given comma-separated list of media types and find which of them are compatible with the specified one to match.
        Parameters:
        toMatch - the media type to match.
        csv - the string to parse.
        Returns:
        the parsed media types that are compatible; the stream may be empty if a parse error occurred or no compatible types were found.

      • acceptsMediaType

        public static boolean acceptsMediaType(org.springframework.http.MediaType toMatch,
                                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Does the given request has an Accept header containing any media type compatible to the one to match?
        Parameters:
        toMatch - the media type to match.
        request - the request.
        Returns:
        true for yes, false for no.
